장점 : 2시간의 즐거운 체험
단점 : 짧다.

9/10

Em tempos que muitos jogos parecem versões de outros e a originalidade ficou meio de lado, são poucos aqueles que podem dizer que são diferentes.

Isso é normal, uma vez que as grandes publishers têm medo de colocar jogos diferentes, pois isso reflete perda de dinheiro.

Entretanto, em 2006, a Valve lançou um jogo diferente e que caiu muito bem no gosto do público: Portal.

Portal foi um jogo que deu tão certo que ganhou diversos memes e referências em várias mídias. Mas o que o Portal tem de diferente que fez o sucesso que é agora?

Vamos descobrir em mais uma análise!

* A historia começou antes do Portal em si

Tudo começou na conceituada Digipen Institute of Technology: um trabalho de conclusão de curso deu origem a um jogo chamado Narbacular Drop. O conceito do jogo é simples: uma princesa incapaz de pular está fugindo de seu calabouço usando habilidades de abrir portais nas paredes. A princesa usa um portal laranja e um azul. Com isso, ela vai abrindo caminho para a liberdade.  O jogo foi lançado e Gabe Newell, fundador da Valve, o descobriu, gostou do conceito, contratou toda a equipe que criou o jogo Narbacular Drop e fez uma proposta: recriar o jogo usando a engine Source, a mesma do Half-Life.

A medida que o jogo foi sendo refeito, mudanças ocorreram: a primeira delas é a narrativa da história, que não era tão interessante. Mexendo ali e aqui, o game Portal começa a tomar corpo da forma que conhecemos, com parte da história sendo contada por meio de mensagens na parede em áreas escondidas.

Outra ideia que foi incorporada foi de uma voz para narrar/treinar como usar os  portais durante as séries de puzzle. Foi usado como teste um programa sintetizador de voz. Dessa forma, foram surgindo as correntes de ideias: e se fosse a voz de um robô com inteligência artificial? E se esse robô tivesse uma personalidade Passiva-Agressiva, estando  de brincadeira com o jogador? Então aí surgiu a GLaDOS, a sarcástica Inteligência Artificial do jogo.

O jogo levou 26 meses para ser concluído e, na metade do ano de 2006, o jogo foi vendido na coletânea Orange Box, que continha, além de Portal, os jogos Half-Life 2 e Team Fortress 2. Também em 2007 levou mais de 30 prêmios “Jogo do Ano” em diversas organizações.

A trilha sonora tem algumas músicas que servem para enfatizar as partes dramáticas do jogo. Entretanto, a maior parte dele possui apenas efeitos sonoros dos equipamentos e cenário e comentários da GLaDOS. Outro destaque é a música de encerramento: “Still Alive”, que viralizou tanto quanto o Companion Cube, um objeto que você deve carregar em uma das fases.

* O Portal está pronto

O gameplay é bastante simples, bem semelhante ao de FPS atuais, com a seguinte diferença: botão esquerdo do mouse abre um portal azul, enquanto o botão direito abre um portal laranja. Portais podem ser colocados em qualquer superfície não metalizada. Quando o jogador atravessa o portal, a inércia do jogador é mantida. Isso permite que eu possa abrir um portal no fundo de um buraco e aproveitar a velocidade ganha na queda para ser arremessado para alcançar lugares mais altos. Por ser um Puzzle que envolve a física, não preciso dizer o quanto ela foi bem implementada.
A narrativa do jogo é contada de duas formas: a primeira pela própria GLaDOS que, conforme vai passando as fases, ela vai revelando as suas verdadeiras intenções. A segunda forma é contada por meio de mensagens deixadas pela parede, geralmente em lugares secretos longe das câmeras  da GLaDOS.

Poucos são os defeitos do jogo. Um deles é que relativamente ele é rápido de fechar, embora os desafios de Time Trial dão um objetivo interessante a mais. Para quem jogou Portal 2, viu que existem diversas formas de aproveitar o mecanismo do jogo, mas, para um game inicial, ele foi bem desenvolvido.

_______________________________________________

Pontos Fortes
_______________________________________________


* Conceito de jogo diferente do que está no mercado;

* Boa narrativa, sem precisar parar o jogo para entender a história;

* ”Still Alive” é uma música obrigatória para um repertório gamer;

_______________________________________________

Pontos Fracos
_______________________________________________

* Jogo bastante curto.

_______________________________________________

Conclusão 
_______________________________________________

Portal é um daqueles jogos diferentes, que não se vê por aí. Também possui uma história interessante por trás do desenvolvimento, onde a ideia começa em um trabalho acadêmico e acaba parando na equipe de desenvolvimento da Valve. Apesar de curto, ele é um bom jogo para quem quiser um game de puzzle físico em primeira pessoa.

To be Honest, this 'game' is not really a game. Its a major set up for Portal 2. This is the introduction into the Half Life Universe and the Portal world, if you've never played many VALVe Games. This game starts off easy, with nothing but you a test subject called Chell. GLaDOS is planning to test your skills assuring you that cake will be your reward for testing. GLaDOS took over the Aperture Science Center as you learn throughout the game, and flooded the place with a neurotoxin, any survivors and she's use them as test subjects. As you progress through the levels, the puzzles get harder, but are not too hard. You'll need a (Drum Roll Please!.......) A whole 2 Hours to FInish it. Yeah, its short. But this game is the backbone to Portal 2. Highly Recommend this game, but suggest playing Portal 2 once you've played this.

9.72/10

Cake is a LIE!!!

Have you ever wanted to take part in cutting edge scientific experiments that may or may not be unethical? Well then this might be the game for you.

First of all the puzzle platforming portal performs plays perfectly……… Um, yes it’s highly addictive and once you overcome every challenge you won’t be able to help yourself but to finish another. The unique portal gun is awesome; creating wormholes through space is amazing fun. When I started playing this game I had high hopes and I was not disappointed. It may be fairly old now but it stands up to the test of time very well.

The game is challenging but fair, if you die you know it was your fault. You will on occasion breeze through one room only to be stumped by the next. The peaks and troughs in the learning curve help to vary things up and keep the game interesting, plus beating a room that is difficult feels really good, I had a great time figuring out all the levels and how to get from point A to B. 

The story is sparse but I get the feeling that was only to add to the constant isolation you feel whilst traversing the Aperture Science Laboratories. The antagonist GLaDOS, whom is really the main character, is fantastic. She has all the witty comments and snide remarks you could want in an evil AI gone mad. Chell the hero remains silent throughout, yet I still ended up connecting with her and her struggle for survival. 

You should get this game especially if it’s on sale; I thoroughly enjoyed this and the sequel. 

Have fun ^_^ Oh and the cake is a lie

Portal on aivan fantastinen peli, kenties jopa yksi parhaimmista peleistä, joita olen koskaan pelannut. Se tarjoaa älytehtäviä, jännitystä, toimintaa ja herättää pelaajassa tunteita.
Olisihan se mieluusti voinut olla hiukan pidempi. Kuitenkin se tarjosi aivan mahtavan pelikokemuksen, joka jokaisen pelaajan kannattaisi kokea.
Maltan tuskin odottaa, että pääsen pelaamaan kakkososaa!

This game should be on some kind of Starter Package or something, because just about ANYONE with a Steam account should have this game! It's reputation precedes it, of course, and it's really as fun as people say it is! It's an FPS that doesn't feel like an FPS; more of a puzzle platformer, in my opinion. The game works well on just about any computer and its personality, its relaxing, yet puzzling mood will entertain any gamer the whole way through!
Fun and relaxing, with some challenges.

On passe son temps à résoudre des énigmes afin de découvrir ce que cache cet endroit mystérieux où est enfermé notre héroine, mais pour cela cette dernière devra utiliser le Portal Gun, une arme permettant de créer différents portails pour se mouvoir dans l'espace, je ne vous en dit pas plus. 

Bref, très bon jeu que je recommande, seule ombre au tableau, une durée de vie plutôt courte, malgré les défis et autres succés.

I own both the console and PC versions of Portal, and I can proudly say the PC version of Portal beats the console version. Graphics are fluid, loading times in the beginning have been cut down, and the mouse and keyboard controls much better than a controller. As for the game itself, Portal has always been fantastic.

Oyun gayet başarılı bir yapım. Portallarla oynamak çok eğlenceli. Tek kötü yanı ilk 15 testin çok kısa olması. Ve sadece 19 test var. Eğer kafanız yeterince çalışıyor ve size verilen mekanı ve silahı iyi kullanabiliyorsanız son 4 test de çok kısa gelecektir. Uzun lafın kısası oyunun süresi az. Hemen bitirmemek için uğraştım ama sürükleyici bir yapısı var yani bunda biraz zorlandım. Yine de oyunda sizi bekleyen sürprizler ile bu eksikleri de tamamlıyor. Ayrıca bitiş jeneriğindeki şarkı da sizi rahatlatıyor ve bu oyunu bu kadar kısa sürede bitirdiğinizi unutturuyor. Almanızı tavsiye ediyorum. Alışageldiğimiz diğer oyunlardan çok daha farklı bir yapısı var. Bu sayede de biraz değişiklik yapmış oluyorsunuz. Hep CoD oynayıp milleti öldürecek, LoL'de başkalarından küfür yiyecek değiliz ya.

Portal, while not as good as the sequel, is a nice puzzle game that makes you think and wanting more at the end of the experiance. portal, for those of you not in the know, is a game revolving around a character named Chell, who is the silent protaganist you play as, and GlaDoS, a robot created by aperture science. GlaDoS taunts you throughout the game, and most of the time, it's very funny. other than that, the game does not have much plot, unless the cliffhanger at the end counts, and of course all the half life references. the gameplay is a fun idea based on another game,Narbacular Drop, where the character shoots portals with a gun to avoid death and solve puzzles. the idea does not falter in conceptualization. most of the 19 test chambers you play through, are pretty fun. the game did make me feel stupid at certain moments for not realizing how to solve the puzzle, even though it was so simple. the physics also seem a bit weird at points, and the jump is a bit stilted, but overall i think it's a good game. it's not the best looking game, but it was an early 7th gen game, so i think it can be excused. it is also a very short game, i finished the game in a little over 2 hours, and in subsequent playthroughs, ive beaten it in less than 45 minutes. However, the legnth, is only a problem if you think you are not getting your money's worth. however, even if you happen to be one of these people, no matter the legnth. the extra challenge maps help the game fix this "problem", although being ridiculously hard at points. Luckily, ALL of the problems i just mentioned were fixed in portal 2. So in the end, should you buy this? i would definately say yes, and if you have enough money, buy the bundle!

Hasta que jugué a Portal, nunca habría imaginado que jugaría a un juego de puzzles en 1ª persona. Pero aquí está Portal.
Tiene unos puzzles muy entretenidos, muy dificiles de catalogar, sólo puede decirse que son puzzles que te permiten avanzar en el juego a base de crear portales que te llevan de un sitio a otro. Alguien diría: "entonces crea uno que te lle ve al final". Jaja. Si tu supieras. Tiene una historia muy simple, pero entretenida, con humor sarcástico. 
La única pega que le puedes poner es que es muy muy corto.

Portal is seen by many as a quintessential PC gaming milestone, and it's not hard to see why.  combining a unique blend of puzzle-solving, first person perspective, incisive humor and impressive graphical power (at least for the time it was released), this game is a wonderful example of what new and inventive things come out of computer gaming, even from up-and-coming or AAA studios.  

To the game play, the player starts off with nothing more than the ability to move, and slowly is led by a calming but increasingly insane computerized female voice to complete what becomes more obvious deathtraps as the game goes along.  The puzzles become more devious, but the game is much less about living through the puzzles.  It is much more about solving the puzzles, which helps to free a player to think outside the box.

And the puzzles from the point of getting the Portal Gun onward all concern physics, spatial awareness and oh yes, a really cool spatial displacement gun. ;)

Many a denizen of the internet will recognize GLADoS, even if they haven't played this game yet.  What many don't fully appreciate, at least to my mind, is how fully the feeling in the game is sculpted by this disembodied voice egging you on, while at the same time insulting you or saying things that frankly wouldn't seem out of place in 2001: A Space Odyssey or some Stephen King novel.  While you may be playing the game and solving the puzzles as Chell, the personality-null protagonist, it's this disturbing combination of Hal and Christine that makes the game so worth-while in narrative terms, especially when the test chambers end and the climax of the game begins.

If you haven't gotten the game already, you should do so, and play it as soon as possible.  It is in many respects required, not just as a mark of inventive combination of  game play mechanics or narrative driven gaming, but also as a cultural understanding of many references of the internet.  Much like the movie Aliens is a required movie to watch to understand many references on the internet, Portal is a requirement for much the same reasons.

Impresionante. La mecánica del juego es fantástica y el personaje de Glados magnífico. Buen planteamiento, aunque corto, con grandes dosis de humor y buena traducción al español. La canción de los créditos fue la guinda del "pastel". Compra segura.

A brilliant game. The puzzles are made so you can progressively learn and put together new tecniques, the difficulty progression is linear and overall puzzles itself aren't hard at all, provided you are a human being willing to elaborate about the odds and unusual puzzles(compared to more classic games)... just a bit!

Graphic wise the game still looks fine in 2014. For a feeling, It feels closer to Half Life 2 than Portal 2, and the minimalistic graphic style points more to the mechanics than to the plot (but that's where Portal 2 stands out of course). 

And Glados humor :) although it's not a defined character as much as in Portal 2, it will still make you smile.
VERY VERY GOOD GAME :D

身为+1党总算趁着放假期间把传送门1给撸完了，前面实验室19关感觉会比较枯燥，当我快完成第19关的时候，神展开配合着出乎意料的的转角和突如其来的音乐出现，之后才是游戏的精髓，所以请耐心坚持到第19关~
       传送门系列最大的卖点就是剧情和音乐，剧情我就不剧透了，音乐在传送门里面其实出现的不多，但是往往出现的非常关键，比如衬托突如其来的紧张的气氛。

PS：另外游戏里面有很多小细节值得注意，比如出现过“BLACK MESA”（黑山基地）。另外，我还不止一次在游戏里发现了红星炸弹=。=

Great game! It is pretty easy, and the flexibility of the solutions to each level makes the timed challenge mode more complex. Also, the "Transmission Recieved" achievement makes it more challenging for the overachievers. I have most of the radios, but I still have a headache or two to defeat still. The advanced test chambers demand better planning, timing, and nerve, and are relatively challenging... until you beat the first couple of levels. From there on, it gets easy until level 18, which puzzled me for a while on the first time playing through on the NORMAL version. The game is not very long. I wish it was longer. It needs to introduce the turrets earlier, if you ask me. If not, it needs to have more turrets and it needs to make removing them more challenging. Even the upgraded version of the turret seems almost harmless if you have a good rame rate. Even the final boss fight was simple and easy to defeat. I do not think difficulty was the point of this game. I think the main point of it was to just introduce players to the idea, concept, story, and format of the Portal series. All of these four things are artfully designed and are quite entertaining. I think the point of this game is to prepare players for the sequel, Portal 2. I have not played the sequel, so I do not know that for sure. If you're looking for just a fun and quick puzzle game that is relatively easy to master, then this is the game for you. If you are looking for more action in your gameplay, this may not be the game for you. I am one of those people, but I still enjoyed, enjoy, and will enjoy this game for a very long time. I think everyone can and should do the same, if they have the right mindset.
buen juego para pensar no solo matar :D

Great game. The game flawlessly combines skill and physics into an unique and unforgetable experince.

This game was great fun.  I couldn't stop playing it.  I would recommend playing this before playing portal 2.  The story in portal 2 will make more sense if you play this one first.  The audio is hularious in this game.  If you had to choose between only this one or only portal 2 I would say go with portal 2 but if you can get both, get both.  Its very worth it.  However once you've beaten portal, you can uninstall it and just play portal 2.
[spoiler] The cake is a lie.... [/spoiler]

Best game ever. Engaging and fun and the story behind it all is fantastically played out. I think that even though Portal 2 is longer and has more content, we knew what to expect in terms of gameplay so Portal kind of tops it for being the unexpected thriller. Well done Valve. Have some cake on me! :D

Es fantástico y muy original.
Por momentos se vuelve un tanto monótono
y la historia se termina muy rápido.
Me pareció excelente la participación 
de la voz en off de GlaDOS.
